Entry.Val: Wits define how quickly the character can act during a challenge.
Primary Physical attribute. Affects carry limits and Health.
Secondary Physical attribute. Affects Gathering, Luck and Health.
Primary Mental attribute. Affects Research and Crafting abilities and Sanity (mental health).
Secondary Mental attribute. Affects Luck, Rituals, Crafting and Gathering abilities and Sanity (mental health).
Primary Spiritual attribute. Affects Research and Rituals abilities and Faith (spiritual health).
Secondary Spiritual attribute. Affects Gathering, Crafting, Research, Rituals, Luck and Faith (spiritual health).
Determines the character's ability to gather materials and the speed at which they do it.
The ability to create items, buildings, cooking food and blending materials.
Learning about new things and studying objects and places.
Provides bonus to Experience Points and improves chance rolls in growing up events.

The maximum amount of Health the character can have. 1 Health point is recovered each turn, regeneration rate can be increased by camping or visiting a Healer's Hut. Health below 30% poses a death risk.

The maximum amount of Sanity the character can have. Regeneration of each Sanity point consumes 2 Morale, up to 20% of maximum Sanity per turn. Sanity below 30% poses a risk of the character leaving your group.
The maximum amount of Faith the character can have. 1 Faith point is recovered each turn, but you can also perform the Spiritual Healing ritual. Faith below 30% causes gradual Health loss.
The amount of renewable protection the character has during a challenge.
The amount of renewable protection the character has during a Physical challenge.
The amount of renewable protection the character has during a Mental challenge.
The amount of renewable protection the character has during a Spiritual challenge.
Position in queue during a challenge's fight phase. Based on Wits, Phase and selected skill.
The remaining amount of Action Points you can spend for playing cards this turn.
The amount of Action Points (AP) required to play this card.

This character has been placed more than once on the battlefield. Each copy has its own action but every time it becomes affected by a skill, all other copies are affected as well. All copies of one character share the same colour.
This character has been summoned and will not exist outside of battle.
The maximum amount of Movement Points (MP) the character has.
The maximum amount of Sea Movement Points (SMP) the character has.

How well does the character feel, their level of approval and attitude towards everything around them.\n\nMorale replenishes Sanity and directly depends on food variety. Each food type increases Morale by 1 per turn until it reaches 10x the carried food types, capped at 100.
How far away the character can see during Day turns.
How far away the character can see during Night turns.
The maximum amount of Hit Points the character can take before they are removed from a challenge.
Current amout of Hit Points during a challenge.
The amout of Shielding Points during a challenge. These normally need to be taken down first before Hit Points are affected by Damage.
This character is the gods' chosen. They are immune to mental death and less likely to be kidnapped, but if they die your time is up.
Beings who are attuned to the forest.
Those who were trained to wield the weaves of magic.
Targets an empty card spot in either ally melee or ally ranged row.
Targets an empty card spot in ally melee row.
Targets an empty card spot in ally ranged row.
Targets 1 enemy in melee row in front of the character. If there is none, any enemy on the battlefield can be targeted.
Targets 1 or more enemy in melee row in front of the character. If there is none, any enemy on the battlefield can be targeted.
Targets 1 closest enemy and up to 2 enemies standing to their left and right.
Targets 1 closest enemy. If the attacker stands in melee row, the attack will splash onto another enemy standing behind the main target.
Targets 1 closest enemy and up to 3 enemies standing right next to them.
Targets 1 closest enemy and all enemies around the target.
Targets 1 enemy standing anywhere on the battlefield.
Targets 2 or more selected enemies standing anywhere on the battlefield.
Targets all enemies standing anywhere on the battlefield.
Targets 1 to 2 enemies chosen at random.
Targets 1 to 3 enemies chosen at random.
Targets 1 to 4 enemies chosen at random.
Targets 1 to 5 enemies chosen at random.
Targets 1 to 6 enemies chosen at random.
Targets 1 to 2 allies chosen at random.
Targets 1 to 3 allies chosen at random.
Targets 1 to 4 allies chosen at random.
Targets 1 to 5 allies chosen at random.
Targets 1 to 6 allies chosen at random.
Targets 1 selected ally standing anywhere on the battlefield.
Targets 2 or more selected allies standing anywhere on the battlefield.
Targets all allies standing anywhere on the battlefield.
Targets 1 or more selected allies standing anywhere on the battlefield and affects allies standing immediately to the left and right to them.
Targets 1 or more selected enemies standing anywhere on the battlefield and affects enemies standing immediately to the left and right to them.
Targets all enemies and allies except the caster.
Targets the group in possession of this item or a character knowing this skill.
Targets only the enemy card located directly opposite in melee or ranged row.
Regular damage. The number typically indicates damage multiplier, or added damage with '+' sign.
Summons a small immobile house demon to your village to help guard it against any threats.
Summons a character to the battlefield.
Summons a character to the battlefield. Only one copy of this character is permitted on the battlefield at any time.
Summons a character to the battlefield. Caster has to be present on the battlefield.
Summons a character to the battlefield at the cost of 50% of the caster's current Health. Only one copy of this character is permitted on the battlefield at any time.
Summons a character to the battlefield at the cost of 20% of the caster's current Health. Only one copy of this character is permitted on the battlefield at any time.
Shielding in Physical and Mental challenges.
Shielding in Physical and Spiritual challenges.
Shielding in Mental and Spiritual challenges.
Regular damage that also increases the affected target's Delay, causing it to act later in the Fight Order queue.
Drain Combat Attributes from the target and boost your next attack.
Improves the overall wellbeing of characters.
Characters in this group have a lower chance to die from heavy wounds.
Characters in this group have a higher chance to die from heavy wounds.
Improves visibility around the village so you will be able to spot enemies from further away.
Workers will be able to perform gathering on tiles further away from the village.
Increases the number of slots in Crafting tasks.
Increases the number of slots in Gathering tasks.
Increases the number of slots in Research tasks.
Increases the number of slots in Rituals tasks.
Provides a bonus to essence for crafts.
A random pet will appear in the affected group's inventory at the start of each season.
Resources will appear in the affected group's inventory at the start of each turn.
Decreases the chance the affected character will die because of wounds.
Keeps the morale of characters on or above a certain level.
Damage reduced if the target has armour.
Deals 150% damage if the target has armour.
If the target has less than maximum hit points, damage is +35%.
Melee weapons with AOE: Splash Damage is 75%.\nRanged weapons: Adds vertical splash.
Returns 40% of the damage dealt as hit points.
Returns 50% of the damage dealt as shield points.
Damages both shield and hit points for the full damage amount each.
If the target has less than maximum hit points, damage is +60%.
Melee weapons with AOE: Splash Damage is 100%.\nRanged weapons: Adds vertical splash.
Returns 80% of the damage dealt as hit points.
Returns 100% of the damage dealt as shield points.
Damage is increased by a fixed value.
Gives a bonus to the primary attribute relevant to the challenge you take part in.
Gives a bonus to the secondary attribute relevant to the challenge you take part in.
Gives a bonus attributes relevant to the challenge you take part in.
Provides a bonus to regeneration of Health (physical hit points).
Provides a bonus to regeneration of Sanity (mental hit points).
Provides a bonus to regeneration of Faith (spiritual hit points).
Provides a bonus to maximum all three health types.
Provides a bonus to maximum Physical health.
Provides a bonus to maximum Mental health.
Provides a bonus to maximum Spiritual health.
Provides a bonus to the Wits attribute.
Provides a bonus to the main attributes: Wits, Strength, Perception, Intelligence, Wisdom, Mysticism, Destiny.
Provides a bonus to the Strength attribute.
Provides a bonus to the Perception attribute.
Provides a bonus to the Intelligence attribute.
Provides a bonus to the Wisdom attribute.
Provides a bonus to the Mysticism attribute.
Provides a bonus to the Destiny attribute.
Provides a bonus to the Gathering attribute.
Provides a bonus to the Research attribute.
Provides a bonus to the Luck attribute.
Provides a bonus to the Rituals attribute.
Provides a bonus to the Crafting attribute.
Provides a bonus to the Gathering, Crafting, Luck, Research and Rituals attributes.
Provides a bonus to the Personal Carry attribute.
Provides a bonus to the Group Carry attribute.
Provides a bonus to the Sea Group Carry attribute.
Provides a bonus to the Movement Points attribute.
Provides a bonus to the Range Of Sight.
Provides a bonus to the Sea Movement Points attribute.
Increases Wits, Strength, Perception, Intelligence, Wisdom, Mysticism and Destiny during night turns.
Lowers Combat Attributes and increases Delay of the target on the Battlefield.
Lower the primary attribute relevant to the challenge you take part in.
Lower the secondary attribute relevant to the challenge you take part in.
Lower the attributes relevant to the challenge you take part in.
The amount of Health regenerated per turn.
The amount of Sanity regenerated per turn.
The amount of Faith regenerated per turn.
Shows how many turns need to pass before this child grows into an adult.
Decreases Delay of a selected Ally's action and increases this character's Combat Attributes.
Decrease Delay of a character on the battlefield, so they will act faster.
Increase Delay of a character on the battlefield, so they will act slower.
Decrease Wits, Strength, Perception, Intelligence, Wisdom, Mysticism and Destiny during day turns.
Increase Health, Sanity and Faith regeneration during day turns.
This character has low Sanity and is considering to leave you.
This character has lowe Health and has a chance to die.
This character has low Faith and is poisioned by magic.
You will (or have chance) to lose some kind of item each turn.
One or more equipment slots are blocked (additionally to any race-specific restrictions).
Reduced character attributes due to having equipped a particular item type.
This subskill's trigger is the same as its parent's trigger.
Places the character on the battlefield in Melee or Ranged row. Subskill effects will activate in Fight Phase according to Fight Order queue.
Places the character on the battlefield in Melee row. Subskill effects will activate in Fight Phase according to Fight Order queue.
Places the character on the battlefield in Ranged row. Subskill effects will activate in Fight Phase according to Fight Order queue.
Places the character on the battlefield in Melee or Ranged row. Subskill effects will activate in Fight Phase according to Fight Order queue.
Places the character on the battlefield in Melee row. Subskill effects will activate in Fight Phase according to Fight Order queue.
Places the character on the battlefield in Ranged row. Subskill effects will activate in Fight Phase according to Fight Order queue.
Does not place the character on the battlefield but queues its effect. Subskill effects will activate in Fight Phase according to Fight Order queue.
Does not place the character on the battlefield and immediately triggers its subskill effects.
Subskill effects are triggered when a character activates any (non-Alternative) Attack subskill.
Subskill effects are triggered when a character activates any Alternative Attack subskill.
Subskill effects are triggered when a character activates any Cast subskill.
Subskill effects are triggered when a character activates any Instant subskill.
Subskill effects are triggered upon starting a challenge.
Subskill effects are triggered when a challenge is ending, regardless of results.
Subskill effects are triggered when another card is played.
Subskill effects are triggered when this card is played.
Subskill effects are triggered when another allied card is played.
Subskill effects are triggered when an enemy card is played.
Subskill effects are triggered when a character is dealt damage.
Subskill effects are triggered when an enemy is killed by a character using this skill.
Passively changes the attributes of each member of affected group.
Subskill effects are triggered when turn starts.
Subskill effects are triggered when turn ends.
Subskill effects are triggered when the group moves.
Neutral Essence that can be used anywhere, but it doesn't give any special properties.
Turmoil - divine domain of change and chaos, born of darkness itself, it is often patron to warfare but also progress.
Harmony - divine domain of peace and order often akin to light, patron of diplomacy and tradition, often at odds with chaos.
Light - divine domain born out of eternal light, patron of justice and directness, unmovable pillar of truth but also stagnation at times.
Magic - divine domain of the mystical forces that bind all things. Patron of witchcraft and wisdom often leads close to darkness.
Nature - divine domain of the natural forces, life, death and rebirth. Patron of forest dwellers, and those who respect the cycle of life.
Intellect - divine domain of the mind and of knowledge. Patron of logic and cold calculation, often at odds with its own divine providence.
Used to stoke the fire in settlements and camps.
Needed for survival of every character. Varied food increases Morale and provides bonuses.
Used for cooking or medicinal purposes.
Other refers to a nonhumanoid character's gender.
Robes. Lightweight and unrestrictive, prime choice for mystics and wise ones.
Medium Armour gives decent protection but isn't too heavy. First choice for scoundrels.
Heavy Armour is tough and sturdy giving best protection. First choice for warriors.
Jewellery can be both ornamental and practical, especially when infused with mystical power.
Little and fragile, needs protection before it can grow into an adult.
A youngster, needs protection before they can grow into an adult. They are stronger than regular children.
A youngster, needs protection before they can grow into an adult. they are more perceptive than younger children.
Proficient in Physical challenges, strong and tough.
A seasoned fighter. Proficient in Physical challenges, strong and tough.
Specialises in crafting items and construction.
Swift hands and sharp eyes make them proficient at harvesting resources.
Adept at hunting prey and scouting.
Clerics of the cosmic pantheon, renowned for their wisdom and devotion to the gods.
Clerics of the cosmic pantheon, renowned for their wisdom and devotion to the gods.
A wise one learned in the ways of herbs and basic medicine. Healers have always been respected, not only for their knowledge, but their willingness to help those in need.

A wise woman, knowing of the mystical ways but often practicing dark magic that taints the soul and body. This is why witches, even those barely adult, can resemble old women. The young witch completed her trials, but was deemed in need of further learning.
An outlaw armed with a bow, preying on the wealthy and the weak.
An outlaw armed with a melee weapon, preying on the wealthy and weak.
A seasoned bandit rascal with a following. Known to have a weakness for pretty faces.
Abandoned by the gods long ago and driven to madness, they survive by any means neccessary.

Scavengers are typically a band of unskilled ruffians, but even among their kind, the dark mark of witchcraft can be found. Scavenger witches are much more likely to fall into corruption and generally have less control than their human or orc counterparts.
The leader of Red Ridge bandits who hold the entrance to an odd, red cave. Bear rules his band with a strong hand, but hides a softer heart beneath it.
Hanka may not be the official leader of the scavenger pack, but it is clear she holds the boss by his balls and makes sure he does as she says.

Monia is shy and timid at first glance, but you soon learn this is a front she used to stay unseen in the brutal scavenger pack. If she joins you, she will soon become more confident and full of joy for her new life.
Slightly more sophisticated than their scavenger kin, nevertheless, hide your silverware around them. They are typically seen in the company of rats.
this guardian barely passed their training which left many scars on their body and mind. Nevertheless they make it their goal to prove one day they can become more.

Proud and stoic protectors of the wildlands. Elves tend to favour diplomacy over violence, or so they like the world to think. Despite this apparent pacifism, the elven warriors are trained from youth to be ruthless and precise. Be it 'the last resort' or 'do as we say or perish' it is not wise to stand against a guardian.
Adept at crafting beautiful items that many would consider art. These artisans tend to reject violence and focus on the art of creation; thus, diplomacy is their preferred path.
Atuned to nature and her gifts, elven gatheres are skilled at harvesting resources. They are nimble but they tend to be fragile and gentle souls.

Wild and animalistic, druids often prefer the company of woodland kin to other humanoids, even those of their own kind. During the days of darkness, the druids were amongst the leaders who held the elven people together long enough to heal the taint of darkness and rebuild. As such, they were the most revered among their people.

Banished druids are an oddity even amongst their typically outsider cast of druids. They refuse to wear anything but weapons and willingly leave the forest in favour of adventure. Despite their unusual behaviours, they are actually considered whimsical and will often bring good humour to those who travel with them.

Keepers of ancient lore and masters of the mystical arts. Often more 'civilised' than their woodland kin due to their affinity for travel and cultural exchange. Apart from very rare exceptions, mages are actually amongst the youngest of the elven kin, because they were the first to perish when darkness took the world in the past.
Corrupted by darkness long ago, a banished caste of assassins more akin to demons of the dark than their own kind.
Shadow elves are those who accepted their dark taint and found an odd balance on their new path. Sadly, many remain torn by their departure from light and cannot achieve this goal.

The matriarch is the leader of a clan and she must prove her worth in both combat and wits before she can claim her status. The title is not strictly hereditary, although the offspring of a previous matriarch is likely to succeed her mother.

Orc witches are said to use an old and twisted form of magic, heavily reliant on blood rituals and sacrifices. How much of this is true remains unclear. Apart from magic, some whisper of their ability to commune with beasts. They are also the ones who hold the knowledge of the clans and form an advisory circle for their matriarch.
Bred for killing and honour, strong, muscular and brutish, if there is more to them, you rarely get a chance to find out.
Not all orcs are destined to be warriors, but only a handful do not fear education. Plodders may be laughed at by their warrior peers, but sometimes their knowledge proves indispensable.

Strong but not really smart. Still, somebody has to do the dirty work. As with many societies, despite their low rank, the workers are the backbone of their clans. They do the work no true born orc will and because they are still orcs, they do their job with ferocity and determination.

Trained seekers that can smell blood for miles. Excellent hunters of both beast or man, skilled at quick, precise kills. Other folk often call them green dogs, but the bloodtrackers have embraced this as their own.
Tinkerers and craftsmen known for their ingenious trinkets, but also great at everyday craftsmanship.
Quick footed and eager to explore, the toilers are skilled at gathering resources for their villages.
Often referred to simply as da boss, the chieftain leads goblin families by wit and guile. Their status is often reflects in their ever growing body mass and reluctance for any physical exertion.

The shamans are spirit walkers who are said to possess the memories of their forefathers. But sometimes, the forefathers find fault in the young shamans and leave a taint that weakens them. They can travel into the realm of the ghosts - the greyworld, and bring great wisdom or sometimes even greater peril.

The shamans are spirit walkers who are said to possess the memories of their forefathers. They can travel into the realm of the ghosts - the greyworld, and bring great wisdom or sometimes even greater peril.

The beast masters are the main heavy hitters of the goblin ranks, due not to their own strength but to their extraordinary ability to train beasts as loyal brothers in arms. The beast masters do not treat their animals as mere tools; they undergo secret rituals known only to their clans and are said to share spiritual bonds.

Elite goblin warriors trained to fight from their boar mounts. Boar riders train their mounts from youth to ensure the best bond and understanding between rider and boar and so this bond often becomes very strong, almost familial.

Light footed and agile, while not as tough as typical warriors they are still fierce and unpredictable. They can have authority issues due to their training in separate autonomous cells. But if their clan is in danger, skirmishers are the ones to fight the long-term battles.
Chiselled in stone and metal the warmasters are ancient, steadfast and unmovable.

There are no blacksmiths that can call themselves equal to the ancient masters of the dwarven metal arts. Apart from their craft they also often hold positions of leadership as great tacticians and sometimes orators.
The runemaster is a title given to the eldest, wisest of the dwarven smith masters who know the ancient, secret arts of carving runes.
Dwarven labourers are the heart and soul of their community, toiling away day and night and gathering resources vital for their kin.
Spitting spiders are known for their projectile attack.
Mutated during the time of darkness, these spiders are bulky and large beyond nature.
Spider queens are ferocious, large and very territorial.
Changed in the days of darkness these bees are forever bloodthirsty.
Dragon bees owe their name to their thick, foreboding, armour-like shell and a fierce, fiery temperament.
The queen of the hive, fiercely territorial and protective of her brood.
The queen of the hive is fiercely territorial and protective of her brood and mighty queens are those who devoured many sisters to rise to this rank.
It is an abomination of spider and bee, a remnant of the days of darkness that twisted many creatures into changed, often horrid forms.

Hulking rats have become the scourge of the awakened Thea. Carrying disease and rabies, these vermin are an unwelcomed sight wherever they go. To make matters worse, rats are known associates of evil witches or the servants of bloodsucking demons.
Gluttonous vermin, spreading disease and always seeking to eat more, including humanoid infants or wounded victims.
Slithering in the shadows ever seeking their next victim.
Royal snakes owe their name to their massive size but also a proud, arrogant demeanour. Descendant from the zmey, these can be deadly enemies.
Starving wolves are the rejects from their pack; sometimes they form new packs of their own, ever more vicious in their drive to survive.

Roaming the land in packs, wolves are fierce, territorial hunters and known allies of night demons. Working in packs, these night stalkers seek out prey wherever they can and are not afraid to attack humanoids.
Alphas are the strongest and most intelligent wolves who lead their packs. Their job is to make sure wolves remain strong in Thea, and they will fight fiercely with any who claim their territory.
Hunted for their good meat and leather, but even a young boar can be very dangerous when rattled.
Wild boars typically travel in packs which makes them formidable prey, even for a skilled hunter.
The giant wild boar is a true beast to watch out for. They are bigger, tougher and single-mindedly focused on defending their territory from all who challenge it.

Bloodsucking rats of the night skies, they serve foul forces and spread disease, but some still call them cute. A single creature, despite its larger size, is still relatively easy to kill, but a swarm of bats can quickly become fatal.
The young of a striga, or servants made by their striga masters as a failsafe. Whatever the truth, these unliving fiends are more than mere nuisance.
Seen as heralds of wisdom, but also twisted by darkness, giant crows can be a real menace.
Royal crows owe their name to their superior stature and elegant demeanour. Some say there were once the chosen messengers of royalty.
Let the sleeping bear lie is known as smart advice in Thea.
Ferocious and mad, rabid bears are unpredictable an extremely dangerous.
Light sick rabid bears are weakened but no less ferocious.
It's a bear, wearing armour - yup.
It's a bear, wearing rusty armour - yup.
They may be small, but water is their domain and within it, you are the prey.
Sharks were once a distant tale for Slavyans, but with the shattering came the sea and with it came these perfect killing machines.
Sea serpents slither silently amongst the waves seeking their prey.
Part aquatic part humanoid, all beast. Demons of the sea were not known to Slavyans, now they terrify all.
Part aquatic part humanoid, all beast. Demons of the sea were not known to Slavyans, now they terrify all. A young czytlica may be weaker, but she is no less brutal.
Jurata the queens of the sea, rulers of the czytlica. Part humanoid part aquatic, they hide their cruel nature behind illusionary beauty and serene voice.
Krakens are creatures of dark legends of old, returned after the shattering to once more bring terror to the seas.
Baba Yaga is one of the oldest Slavyan demons, but her true nature remains hidden. Is it a witch gone too far? An apparition of darkness? Or simply another tormented soul twisted by sorrow?
Skshack is a house demon and as such, it can have mischievous nature. He is also known to do the bidding of the gods from time to time.
Divine Skshack is a house demon and as such, it can have mischievous nature. He is also known to do the bidding of the gods from time to time.
Poludnica, or the midday lady is a field demon who appears at high noon and can cause sudden death to farmers or stray children.
Poludnica, or the midday lady is a field demon who appears at high noon and can cause sudden death to farmers or stray children.
An evil-natured, goblin-like creature that tends to prefer living underground, often tunnelling under structures to weaken them on purpose.
An evil-natured, goblin-like creature but weakened by light-sickness.
The cmuch is a shy, recluse of a demon. It lives in the swamps and is said to attack weakened or wounded folk, but it is also said to have healing properties.
The cmuch is a shy, recluse of a demon. It lives in the swamps and is said to attack weakened or wounded folk, but it is also said to have healing properties.
Bies is a dark and foreboding beast that is known to possess its victims and have them wreak havoc upon the land.
Bies is a dark and foreboding beast that is known to possess its victims and have them wreak havoc upon the land.
Part bird, part humanoid, known to sit on rocks by the water and enchant menfolk - for that, they are sometimes confused with the jurata.
Part bird, part humanoid, known to sit on rocks by the water and enchant menfolk - but this one seems weakened by light sickness.
Part bird, part humanoid sister of the syrin. Alkonost are very temperamental and known to turn nasty on a whim.
Part bird, part humanoid sister of the syrin. Alkonost are very temperamental and known to turn nasty on a whim and this one is infected with the light sickness.
Devious creatures, always looking for ways to be mean and have extremely high opinion of themselves.

Small, winged critters, with big eyes and tiny teeth. Very mischievous and playful, but they have been known to lead people astray into some real bad trouble. They can also get a bit touchy about their size and you better be careful about lending them anything as returning stuff is not their strong suit. They are very fond of games.

Pineconettes are the smallest but also most common of the guardians of the forest. They take on the form of pine cones, flowers or mushrooms, or sometimes, they can become almost humanoid, the size of a toddler, but they retain some features of forest vegetation. Despite their size, they can become ferociously aggressive when in a pack.
Thoroughly pissed off pineconettes that have grown to become pretty vicious when needed. Or, wiser, older spirits, depends on your luck.
The leshy is the ancient shepherd of the forest and the grand spirit of the woodlands. They can appear as old, bearded men or walking trees.
The dormant leshy is the ancient shepherd of the forest, but this one is not fully awakened from its tree sleep.
Vily are wind demons but also loyal guardians of the woodlands often serving the leshy when needed. They can appear during, or even cause a storm.
Vily are wind demons but also loyal guardians of the woodlands often serving the leshy when needed. They can appear during, or even cause a storm.
Viatroviec are spirits of the wind and nature. They often form an alliance with forest demons and serve as guardians alongside their vily sisters.
Also known as wolf men, werewolves are seen as both blessed by the moon lord and yet cursed with the beast taint.
Also known as wolf men, werewolves are seen as both blessed by the moon lord and yet cursed with the beast taint.
Those born with extra row of teeth, a unibrow, or uncommon organs all risk awakening after death to become striga and haunt their own loved ones.
A fiend of the night yet cursed by light, which makes it weaker, but also angrier.
A striga master is adept at hiding their true nature, luring beautiful women to become his eternal brides - or dinner.
A striga master touched by the light-sickness, making him more unstable.
A striga mistress beguiles unsuspecting men with the illusion of beauty only to lure them as her mates, or her playthings.
A striga mistress previously attacked by the lightbringers, she now carries their taint of her dark soul.
The cmok is said to be the stallion of the striga mistress and the doom of those who see it flying in the night.
Formidable and ancient water demon. Once master of the lakes and rivers, now challenged by the appearance of the seas.
Formidable and ancient water demon that fought off an attack from the lightbringers, but not without a price. He is now weaker than his peers.
The rusalkas are equal in beauty and ferocity. Unable to bear offspring without the aid of a human, they are known to lure both children and men for their own, dark desires.
The rusalkas are equal in beauty and ferocity. The light-sickness weakens her dark soul, but not her ferocious desires.
Often confused with the drowned, the utopiec are water demons loyal to the vodnik, territorial and less likely to use tricks favouring directness.
Befuddler is the male child of a rusalka, as such he is an abomination, neither man nor water nymph, they are often killed by their own mothers.
Befuddler is the male child of a rusalka, rejected by his mother and now also tainted by light. He is not a happy fella.
Dziad mroz is an ancient, mysterious creature roaming frozen lands in chilling silence. Seeing one would often herald a nasty winter.
Sniezynki are ice demonettes who inhabit frozen lands, they are curious of warm blooded creatures, but can turn icy very quickly.
A seemingly pretty light demon, but used by lightbringers to scout for victims.
Mysterious light fiends that seek out the living to assimilate them into their one-mind.
Light-taken humans are alive and able, but only act in clusters.

Dwarves are creatures carved in light, as such, they hear the call of the lightbringers loudly. Their natural resistance is high, and many die before falling to the light, but this one clearly succumbed, and now serves the light-hive.
A spider queen taken by the lightbringers and joined into their light-hive.
Rickety, broken skeleton that has seen better unliving days.
Walking corpse called to its unlife by some unnatural power.
Animated bones of a human, called to the unlife to serve some dark power.
Thick, bulky bones of an orc, animated into unlife and just as keen on killing as its living counterpart.
Unliving corpse of a drowned person brought back into unlife by dark magic.
The spirit of a person unable or unwilling to cross over into the underworlds. Ghosts are often bound to this unlife by unresolved business, or simply a strong desire to hold on to their old life.
Tormented soul that was torn out of its body and left to roam the land in anger. Wraiths are often bound to cursed objects, or places.
Called into the unlife by foul magic, they are ever more vile and disease ridden than their living kin.
Awakened back to unlife these venomous spider corpses are the stuff of nightmares.
Once a majestic drake, now the unliving corpse animated by some dark magic.
As old as time itself, Dragons have long been masters of the skies and keepers of greatest treasures. Some really like virgins too.

The zmey is an ancient creature, a dragon, yet more snake like than their cousins - stories talk of one zmey who is chaos incarnate, some even whisper of his secret ties to the cosmic tree and the old god Veles. The common zmey are either his offspring or avatars. Unlike their fiery cousins, who favour physical confrontations, the zmey often employ their wits and silver, forked tongues to entice people to mischief and misery.
Small blobs of swamp that can spit and are surprisingly talkative. They are the offspring of mud trolls, although only very few will ever grow into one.

Icicles are thought to be the young forms of the ice trolls. They typically roam in packs and stay close to their guardian's lair. Some legends say that they are the tears of lady winter cried every spring when the snows melt and her effigy is sacrificed.
Lava Rockers are small specks of volcanic rock, the fiery offspring of the lava troll.
Often seen as swarms of cascading pebbles, rockers are the young of rock trolls. Only some will ever grow into adults, but they are still extremely attached to their parents.
The most common of trolls. Likes to eat, especially humans. Prone to bribery and guarding bridges for money.
The least violent of troll kind, but no lesss dangerous when pushed. Their natural habitat is swamps, but some can settle outside.
Solitary creature seen mainly in the desolate ice plains. They are said to be ruled by the dziod mroz, like every other creature of the ice plains.
Risen from the hot pits of molten lava, these trolls are extremely aggressive and like to incinerate folks and challenge them to unfair duels.

Said to have been a giant during the awakening, taken by darkness and twisted into a creature of the shadows. The mroki now dwell in the lands of darkness, together with shadow elves they form the Shadowkin.
Said to have been a giant during the awakening, taken by darkness and twisted into a creature of the shadows. As an elder of its kind, this mroki is especially dangerous.
The corpse of a zmey, an elder creature of darkness, taken by the light beast when it escaped from the core of the earth.
Ancient guardians of dwarven treasures and sacred places deep in the earth's core. Some say they are actual dwarven champions turned to stone and metal to serve for eternity.
This is what you get when you try your hand at summoning something you can't handle.
Kraken tentacles have a life of their own and you best avoid their attention.
Once they were an elven druid, now they follow the path of the forest fully shedding any constraints of civilisation in favour of becoming a beast.
The call of the wild drove these elven druids to become truly one with nature. Wild and free they roam the forest ever vigilant and very territorial.
A vicious, rodent-like creature known to steal away children in its sack.
A rare forest demon that doesn't actually like the company of animals. This one is clearly infected with light-sickness, making it weaker, but likely meaner too.
A rare forest demon that doesn't actually like the company of animals. Beware, they carry grudges like their wrinkles once crossed!
This typically elusive forest demon has taken possession of an enchanted pipe that allows him to lure children into his twisted lair, where he drains their blood for power.

A hooded warrior clad in heavy armour and roaming the land to seek revenge. Once a legendary warlord of Perun, his soul was stolen by the machinations of dwarven runemasters and bound to eternal servitude.
A mysterious and rare demon that is said to have the ability to mimic its victims.
A mysterious creature found lurking the swamps. They are often thought to be an offshoot of the bies, and as such considered as deceptive and dangerous.
Only known as the Alchemist, a figure clad in mystery, but clearly in service of your gods, or is he?
A wind elemental demon that is often in leagues with witches for some reason. They thrive during storms but are typically harmless if you stay out of their way.

These days more commonly known as tooth fairy, a self-imposed re-branding. It is a fierce and often outright mean creature that does not wait for you to leave teeth under your pillow as some naive storytellers will tell. Instead, folk who have toothache take special care to try and ward off from the forest fiend, before it rips the offending tooth out by force.
A rare creature indeed, as most orc males with magic are killed. Perhaps his profession explains that?
Necromancers meddle with the dark arts of life and death and in doing so, they tend to break the laws of nature to create their unliving abominations.
The origin or nature of the warrakus is unclear. It is a creature of pure metal and yet it is animated. Some call it demon work, curse, others whisper of dwarven handiwork.

The origin or nature of the warrakus is unclear. It is a creature of pure metal and yet it is animated. Some call it demon work, curse, others whisper of dwarven handiwork. The light seems unable to claim them, but it does weaken the metal.

Iron Storm is a young warrior of stone and iron who has proven his unshaken loyalty to the dwarven kin time and again. If he agrees to join you it is to show your young gods what a true dwarf is made of.
Common timber suitable mostly for firewood.
Fabled to be the gift of the dryads. Black wood that releases golden resin when cut.
Wood from a forest tainted by darkness long ago. If used carefully it can be crafted in many ways.\n\nWild resource ({ICON:WildResourceIcon}).
Nimble yet resilient, elven wood is a valued resource throughout the lands.\n\nImproved resource ({ICON:ImprovedResourceIcon}).
Found in the depths of ancient, elven forests and said to keep the wisdom and memory of the ages past, it is both rare and beautiful.
Fossilized tree resin, commonly used in crafting.
Beautiful green crystal stone, used as an ornament and for crafting.
Shiny crystal gemstone. Can come in many colours and is widely used in crafting.\n\nImproved resource ({ICON:ImprovedResourceIcon}).
Often referred to as the blood-stone, the ruby is a sought-after gemstone. Fable says the hearts of powerful striga turn to ruby upon death.\n\nWild resource ({ICON:WildResourceIcon}).
Diamond is not only a girl's best friend, everyone likes it. It's rare, tough and beautiful.
Bones are a common resource used for crafting.
Bones of unfortunates carrying a heavy curse so that their bones bleed even after death.\n\nImproved resource ({ICON:ImprovedResourceIcon}).
Bones of creatures so tainted by the dark a shadow seeped deep into their core.\n\nWild resource ({ICON:WildResourceIcon}).
Durable and impressive, trophies from slain monsters are used both as ornament and crafting.
Rare crafting material and trophy. Sharp as mithril, tough as stone, mighty as the fallen drakes themselves.
More durable than normal leather and has that nice scaly shine to it.\n\nImproved resource ({ICON:ImprovedResourceIcon}).
Heavier than normal leather, and the fur is great for those long winter nights.
Rare leather, typically found on those who were born of magic.\n\nWild resource ({ICON:WildResourceIcon}).
Found only on the most rare, mythical beasts, valued for its durability and beauty.
Not as durable as some metals, but still sought after especially for ornaments, trinkets and jewellery. Bandits and dragons love it.\n\nWild resource ({ICON:WildResourceIcon}).
As they say, sharp as steel. Good crafting material all around.
Apart from its quality as a metal, silver has been known to repel some night demons, especially werewolves.\n\nImproved resource ({ICON:ImprovedResourceIcon}).
Rare and sought-after metal sometimes known as dwarven blood, due to their strong affinity for the metal.
Commonly used for crafting and building.
Not the most glamorous, but very versatile and commonly used for craft.
Good quality stone, also valued for its sharp looks.\n\nImproved resource ({ICON:ImprovedResourceIcon}).
Very tough and durable, often used for gravestones.\n\nWild resource ({ICON:WildResourceIcon}).
Also referred to as the black stone, it is fabled to come from the blackened hearts of those corrupted by darkness.
Pure, unadulterated stone power.\n\nThis composite fits into Stone material category.

Stone, with some armour to boot. Yup.

This composite fits into Stone and Metal material categories.

Wild resource ({ICON:WildResourceIcon}).
Sharper and stronger together, composite metal.\n\nThis composite fits into Metal material category.

Tough and durable leather moulded using ancient, foreign techniques.

This composite fits into Metal and Leather material categories.

Improved resource ({ICON:ImprovedResourceIcon}).
Bound by craft masters for extreme durability in combat.\n\nThis composite fits into Leather material category.

First choice for achieving that special, ruffian style.

This composite fits into Leather and Bone material categories.

Wild resource ({ICON:WildResourceIcon}).
Powerful runes were carved into the bones - the question is, was the recipient alive?\n\nThis composite fits into Bone material category.

Infused with remnants of mystical force, excellent for crafting.

This composite fits into Bone and Gem material categories.

Improved resource ({ICON:ImprovedResourceIcon}).
Fused together in perfect, grand harmony.\n\nThis composite fits into Gem material category.

Crafted using ancient elven techniques, both beautiful and extremely resilient for wood.

This composite fits into Gem and Wood material categories.

Wild resource ({ICON:WildResourceIcon}).
Made using techniques passed on from forest guardians, it is said to hold their blessing within.\n\nThis composite fits into Wood material category.

Combined thanks to knowledge of both elves and dwarves to create a truly unique blend.

This composite fits into Wood and Stone material categories.

Improved resource ({ICON:ImprovedResourceIcon}).

Pristine Matter was developed by alchemists before darkness destroyed civilisation.

This composite fits into Wood and Stone material categories.

Improved resource ({ICON:ImprovedResourceIcon}).

Moonstone owns its name to the precise moon phases that are needed for its creation.

This composite fits into Stone and Metal material categories.

Wild resource ({ICON:WildResourceIcon}).

The Secret Alloy is, well, secret.

This composite fits into Stone and Metal material categories.

Improved resource ({ICON:ImprovedResourceIcon}).

Cooling and solidification of specific materials sometimes results in a beautiful crystalline substance like this one.

This composite fits into Leather and Metal material categories.

Wild resource ({ICON:WildResourceIcon}).

Alchemy Skin - another secret form of the alchemists of the bygone era.

This composite fits into Leather and Metal material categories.

Improved resource ({ICON:ImprovedResourceIcon}).

Extremely flexible and mouldable composite.

Fits into Leather and Bone material categories.

Wild resource ({ICON:WildResourceIcon}).

It is said that Wyrm Silk is derived from a Zmey in heat - crafters hope it is only a rumour.

This composite fits into Leather and Bone material categories.

Improved resource ({ICON:ImprovedResourceIcon}).

Forgotten Essence... what was it?

This composite fits into Bone and Gem material categories.

Wild resource ({ICON:WildResourceIcon}).

Dark as the void, bright as the stars.

This composite fits into Bone and Gem material categories.

Improved resource ({ICON:ImprovedResourceIcon}).

The ancient secret of obtaining the Earth Core belongs to the dwarves. Some still resent its use outside of dwarven forges.

This composite fits into Gem and Wood material categories.

Wild resource ({ICON:WildResourceIcon}).

Life Root's secrets were passed down from the forest folk.

This composite fits into Gem and Wood material categories.

Improved resource ({ICON:ImprovedResourceIcon}).

God's Branch is said to be passed down directly from the old goddess Mokosh before she disappeared.

This composite fits into Wood and Stone material categories.

Wild resource ({ICON:WildResourceIcon}).
Meat, the basis of diet for any strong-person out there.
Fish has become very common after the shattering flooded the land with sea water.
Vegetables are the basis of a good diet, pickled, stewed, boiled or fresh. Best seasons for gathering - Spring {ICON:Spring} and Summer {ICON:Summer}
Herbs are great for cooking and herbalism. Best seasons for gathering - Spring {ICON:Spring} and Summer {ICON:Summer}
Fruit - got to get those five-a-day. Best seasons for gathering - Spring {ICON:Spring} and Summer {ICON:Summer}
Grain may be a bit boring but is very versatile in the kitchen. Best seasons for gathering - Summer {ICON:Summer} and Autumn {ICON:Autumn}
Spices - there's always time to spice up your life. Best seasons for gathering - Summer {ICON:Summer} and Autumn {ICON:Autumn}
Nuts, crunchy and tasty, just be warned of the squirrels trying to steal them from you. Best seasons for gathering - Summer {ICON:Summer} and Autumn {ICON:Autumn}
Mushrooms - wild or grown, they taste good and can give you visions. Best seasons for gathering - Summer {ICON:Summer} and Autumn {ICON:Autumn}
Eggs, scrambled, boiled, poached - all yummy.
Cosmic Seed is the fruit of the cosmic tree itself, a sacred material given to mortals by the gods to help rebuild Thea.
A rather weird kind of rock. Quite useless for crafting but at least it burns well.
These shiny floating crystals look a bit unusual. Maybe they were sent by the gods to aid you? Gather them and uncover bits of ancient knowledge stored within.
If you have nothing better to do, you can at least to try and think for a while. Maybe something useful will come to mind?
Remember than blue crystals you've gather from the artefact on your last trip? Spend some time researching it and maybe you'll learn something.
That soft, red sticky bit you've picked up after a fight... If you wonder what it's for, there's only one way to find out. Research!
A light, very versatile weapon, suitable for holding in one hand.
A heavier type of sword, requires two hands but the damage will splash to the left and right from the main target.
A small axe, more suited for cutting down trees than fight. Held in one hand.
A big and heavy two-handed axe.
A rather primitive, but still quite effective blunt weapon capable of dealing splash damage around the main target. Held in one hand.
A big, heavy and quite unwieldy weapon but it's smashing power is hard to match. Can deal splash damage around the main target. Requires both hands.
A long, straight stick with a sharp tip, capable of first strike attack. Held in one hand.
A long shaft with an axe mounted at the top, capable of first strike attack. Requires both hands.
Bows and crossbows allow attacking any enemy from the ranged row. Needs two hands to use.
A set of shorter and lighter spears, good for throwing at your enemies.
A small, well-crafted item of cultural importance. It's easy to carry around in one hand. Can deal splash damage around the main target.
Bulky, yet very pretty artefact. Requires both hands to use. Can deal splash damage around the main target.
A simple cloth reinforced with bits of hardened leather. Provides only basic protection but is cheap to produce and lightweight.
A suit of armour, sturdy enough to keep you safe.
Reinforced suit of armour, provides good protection against blows but requires good strength to wear.
Provides additional protection when held, can also be used to protect another ally.
A thin stick said to have magical properties. Attacks at a distance but requires both hands.
A page of script on decorative rollers. Held in one hand.
A book constructed of many pages scribbled with important information. Needs both hands to use.
A small decorative item worn for personal adornment, often a symbol of cultural status.
Gathering is much more efficient when you've got the right tools.
Crafting is much more efficient when you've got the right tools.
Somehow this little ring feels full of energy. Just put it on your finger, you know you want to...
A basic vessel that will allow you to sail.
A blessed vessel that will allow you to sail.
A decent boat that will allow you to sail and maybe take some supplies too.
If you're serious about water travel, this is what you want.
Loyal steed, treasured companion to any hero.
Tamed goat especially trained to carry your stuff.
It's a bunny. Really, it is!
Cat allows you to be its loyal servant.
This wolf decided you're the alpha.
Tamed bear, so long as you feed it honey you should be okay.
A friendly house demon who decided you're worthy of its blessings.
A shy and not so pretty demon, but he will bring you good health when befriended.
Try calling me a pet again, you pathetic bag of flesh!
The best companion for a witch.
Your very own creepy crawly friend.

Although commonly known as the iron frog, wise ones know this creature to be called a turtle. It is extremely rare in Slavya, but they are as old as the elves and thus grant one's keeper their knowledge when you rub their shell three times, anti-clockwise.
Your Slavyan Cock is the envy of all your neighbours.
A sculpted figure dedicated to a deity. Builds your village.
Roofed storage space. Increases the number of gathering slots, may also increase Gathering attribute.
The only home of every true craftsman. Increases the number of crafting slots and increases Crafting attribute.
For storing and maintaining equipment. Increases Shielding of villagers.
Knowledge dwells under its roof. Increases Research attribute, provides research points each turn and increases the number of research slots.
Home Sweet Home. A warm and cosy place that ensures your Morale does not fall too low.
The funny smell coming from inside doesn't bother you at all. Improves health regeneration and scares away the greedy claws of death.
A well that gives not only water but resources as well.
Lumber Mill provides wood. Especially useful if there are no forests growing nearby.
With this playground, your kids can practice while playing! Increases main attributes of children.
A high tower that increases health physical and mental.
On the forest edge there is small hut on a chicken leg. It provides a bonus to Rituals attribute and something extra depending on resource used for its construction.
A small field that will provide a bit of food and chance for pet.
A hole in the ground that provides a small amount of crafting materials each turn.
Traders will sometimes visit this settlement. Also provides a metal bar or a gem each turn.
Pulpety, Slavyan meatballs the way granny made it.
Golabki, meat and grain wrapped in cabbage and baked in sauce.
Rolada is nice chunk of meat rolled with veggies, herbs or anything else you found and baked.
Grilled Meat: nothing beats a good barbeque.
Fish Cake food of choice for most kids.
Grilled Fish, fresh from the water and onto the grill, yum.
Quiche, egg and any leftovers thrown in, yummy stuff.
Galart is like a jelly with veggies and meat, or fish.
Jellied Greens, not exciting, but will feed you.
Spiced Jelly, well, it's jelly with spices, kind of works.
Bigos is sauerkraut with mushrooms and meat all stewed for hours to make a Slavyan winter classic.
Leczo, veggies, meat and tomato sauce all fried together.
Grochowka, wholesome bean soup, best keep at bay after if you're on a date.
Pierogi, a Slavyan classic, dough dumplings with various fillings.
Fruit pie, hot fruit in pastry, yum.
Dwarf Moonshine, if you ain't a dwarf, you best think twice before you drink it.
Mushroom Gulash, anything you had thrown together in a pan and stewed for hours until it tastes good.
Mushroom Bake, warning, can cause visions.
Fried Mushroom, not mind blowing, but will feed you.
Plum Roast, very sweet and warming.
Veggie Bake, if meat is scarce, you gotta eat something.
Jam all the sweet goodness of summer fruits in a jar.
Gobbo Wine is known to send you into the ghost-world, there's likely shrooms in it.
Nutty Stew, if you do it right, it still has that crunch to it.
Muesli, breakfast of choice for fancy folk.
Nut Tincture. If it sounds suspicious then it probably is, so consume at your own risk.

Allows you to craft 1- and 2-Handed Swords that also provide shielding.

Sword ({ICON:Handed1}) - very high speed, low damage.

Greatsword ({ICON:Handed2}) - high speed, medium damage, area of effect.

Increase your proficiency in crafting 1-Handed Swords. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-SWORD_1H_1}% bonus to Essence.

Further increase your proficiency in crafting 1-Handed Swords. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-SWORD_1H_2}% bonus to Essence.

Increase your proficiency in crafting 2-Handed Swords. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-SWORD_2H_1}% bonus to Essence.

Further increase your proficiency in crafting 2-Handed Swords. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-SWORD_2H_2}% bonus to Essence.

Allows you to craft 1- and 2-Handed Axes.

Hatchet ({ICON:Handed1}) - high speed, medium damage.

Battle Axe ({ICON:Handed2}) - high speed, very high damage.

Increase your proficiency in crafting 1-Handed Axes. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-AXE_1H_1}% bonus to Essence.

Further increase your proficiency in crafting 1-Handed Axes. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-AXE_1H_2}% bonus to Essence.

Increase your proficiency in crafting 2-Handed Axes. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-AXE_2H_1}% bonus to Essence.

Further increase your proficiency in crafting 2-Handed Axes. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-AXE_2H_2}% bonus to Essence.

Allows you to craft 1- and 2-Handed Clubs that also deal area of effect damage.

Club ({ICON:Handed1}) - low speed, low damage.

Mallet ({ICON:Handed2}) - low speed, high damage.

Increase your proficiency in crafting 1-Handed Clubs. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-CLUB_1H_1}% bonus to Essence.

Further increase your proficiency in crafting 1-Handed Clubs. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-CLUB_1H_2}% bonus to Essence.

Increase your proficiency in crafting 2-Handed Clubs. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-CLUB_2H_1}% bonus to Essence.

Further increase your proficiency in crafting 2-Handed Clubs. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-CLUB_2H_2}% bonus to Essence.

Allows you to craft 1- and 2-Handed Polearms that may also attack from Ranged Row or deal area of effect damage.

Spear ({ICON:Handed1}) - medium speed, low damage.

Polearm ({ICON:Handed2}) - low speed, medium damage.

Increase your proficiency in crafting 1-Handed Polearms. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-POLEARM_1H_1}% bonus to Essence.

Further increase your proficiency in crafting 1-Handed Polearms. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-POLEARM_1H_2}% bonus to Essence.

Increase your proficiency in crafting 2-Handed Polearms. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-POLEARM_2H_1}% bonus to Essence.

Further increase your proficiency in crafting 2-Handed Polearms. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-POLEARM_2H_2}% bonus to Essence.

Allows you to craft 1- and 2-Handed Scrolls that do not have basic attack skill.

Scroll ({ICON:Handed1}) - low speed, medium damage, 2 additional spells.

Codex ({ICON:Handed2}) - low speed, high damage, 2 additional spells.

Increase your proficiency in crafting 1-Handed Scrolls. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-SCROLL_1H_1}% bonus to Essence.

Further increase your proficiency in crafting 1-Handed Scrolls. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-SCROLL_1H_2}% bonus to Essence.

Increase your proficiency in crafting 2-Handed Scrolls. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-SCROLL_2H_1}% bonus to Essence.

Allows you to craft 1- and 2-Handed Artefacts that specialise in Spiritual and Mental challenges dealing area of effect damage.

Artifact ({ICON:Handed1}) - medium speed, low damage.

Relic ({ICON:Handed2}) - medium speed, medium damage, additional spell.

Increase your proficiency in crafting 1-Handed Artefacts. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-ARTIFACT_1H_1}% bonus to Essence.

Further increase your proficiency in crafting 1-Handed Artefacts. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-ARTIFACT_1H_2}% bonus to Essence.

Allows you to craft Bows, Wands and Thrown Spears that can deal Ranged damage.

Bow - low speed, low damage, can target any enemy.

Wand - very low speed, medium damage, contains a special Spiritual skill.

Thrown Spears - very low speed, medium damage.
Increase your proficiency in crafting Bows. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-BOW_1}% bonus to Essence.

Further increase your proficiency in crafting Bows. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-BOW_2}% bonus to Essence.

Increase your proficiency in crafting Wands. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-WAND_1}% bonus to Essence.

Further increase your proficiency in crafting Wands. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-WAND_2}% bonus to Essence.

Increase your proficiency in crafting Thrown Spears. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-THROWN_SPEARS_1}% bonus to Essence.

Further increase your proficiency in crafting Thrown Spears. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-THROWN_SPEARS_2}% bonus to Essence.
Allows you to craft Jewellery which provides passive bonuses.

Increase your proficiency in crafting Jewellery. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-JEWELLERY_1}% bonus to Essence.

Further increase your proficiency in crafting Jewellery. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-JEWELLERY_2}% bonus to Essence.
Allows you to craft Shields which provide both passive Shielding and a skill to increase Shielding during a challenge.

Increase your proficiency in crafting Shields. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-SHIELDS_1}% bonus to Essence.

Further increase your proficiency in crafting Shields. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-SHIELDS_2}% bonus to Essence.

Allows you to craft Robes, Medium Armours and Heavy Armours.

Robes - low passive Shielding bonus.

Medium Armour - medium passive Shielding bonus.

Heavy Armour - high passive Shielding bonus.

Increase your proficiency in crafting Robes. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-ROBES_1}% bonus to Essence.

Further increase your proficiency in crafting Robes. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-ROBES_2}% bonus to Essence.

Increase your proficiency in crafting Medium Armour. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-MEDIUM_ARMOUR_1}% bonus to Essence.

Further increase your proficiency in crafting Medium Armour. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-MEDIUM_ARMOUR_2}% bonus to Essence.

Increase your proficiency in crafting Heavy Armour. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-HEAVY_ARMOUR_1}% bonus to Essence.

Further increase your proficiency in crafting Heavy Armour. You will be able to use an additional primary and secondary material type and will receive a {SCRIPT:UIS_GetEssenceGrow,ITEM_TECH-HEAVY_ARMOUR_2}% bonus to Essence.
A shiny that provides small amounts of protection.
A shiny that provides a small bonus to Wits and Inteligence.
A shiny that provides a small bonus to Perception and Destiny.

Fast, brutal and unexpected. Create chaos in the enemy's head.

Any enemy hit by the powder gets dizzy and confused.

With a little bit of chemistry, you can prepare poison and use it on your enemies.
The gods speak their powerful word through you, crushing your opponent's will and spirit.
The cold touch of a spirit that chills to the bone.
Your words are wise and based on sound logic.
A Spiritual attack draining your enemies' soul.
Aggressive words that poison anybody who hears them.

Attack from the sky, where the attacker chooses any opponent.

An outburst of spiritual and mental energy.
There is something overwelming in your presence.
Throw two daggers at your opponents.
You know how to convince another person to give you what you need...
In a brawl it will only get your teeth kicked in, but you know how to shine in a conversation.
Step forward with fury and give out an angry shout at your enemy.
A good strategy is possible only if warriors follow the orders of their commander.
Warn your ally to be reasonable, think rationally or take cover from danger.
Whatever your friend is doing, they need to do it quicker.

Drains foe leaving an empty shell.

This armour not only protects from physical harm, it also improves combat abilities.
If the Light commands to strike, you obey.
A powerful fire that could burn any unprotected flesh like a dry twig.
A powerful poison that was inside the belly of that baest right over you head!
A roar that terrifies all living beings even many miles away.
No armour can stop Zmey's teeth. They can chew even through the hardest metal.
Zmey's tail not only hits like a whip but can also steal life from the enemies.
The chains not only hit like a whip but can also steal life from the enemies.
Attack that damages your target's combat attributes and makes yours stronger.
This character carries too much equipment and is over encumbered. They will drop a random item back to the group's inventory at the end of this turn.

Your Character is below 30% of their Health (Physical HP). They have a chance to die and is greater the more Health they are missing. A bit of Health regenerates each turn naturally, regeneration can be increased by camping, provided the group has fuel to burn.

The character is below 30% of their Sanity (Mental HP). They now suffer a negative damage multiplier and may leave you. Sanity is regenerated by consuming Morale (2 Morale for 1 Sanity point until it regenerates completely).

The character is below 30% of their Faith (Spiritual HP). They now receive physical damage each turn. A bit of Faith regenerates each turn naturally, to recover a bigger portion - perform a Spiritual Healing ritual while camping or in a village.
Toxins rage through your bloodstream, causing damage.
A sickness strikes and weakens you for a time. Lowers movement and all health points.
A curse of the body that weakens your max health and slows your movement. Curses last until removed.
A curse of the mind that weakens your intelligence and wisdom. Curses last until removed.
A curse of the soul that weakens your mysticism and destiny. Curses last until removed.
Blessing of the body, temporarily increases your max physical health and movement.
Blessing of the mind, temporarily increases your intelligence and wisdom.
Blessing of the spirit, temporarily increases your mysticism and destiny.
Gloom and doom. Maybe I'd be better off on my own?\n\nThis character has Morale below 0. For each point below 0 they have 1% chance to leave your party.
This life is hard.\n\nThis character has low Morale. Try to improve it before it falls below 0 or they might part ways with your group.
I need a drink...\n\nThis character's Morale is not too great.
Could be worse, I guess?\n\nThis character's Morale is normal.
It's not that bad really.\n\nThis character's Morale is fair.
Starting to enjoy it.\n\nThis character's Morale is good.
It's my lucky day!\n\nThis character's Morale is great.
Bring it on!\n\nThis character's Morale is excellent.
Let's celebrate!\n\nThis character's Morale is fantastic.
I could move mountains!\n\nThis character's Morale is oustanding.
Life doesn't get better than this!\n\nThis character's Morale is perfect.
This character is a Snake. Its still, glossy eyes make people feel uneasy. Or is it because of the venomous bite it is capable of?
This character is a Spider. Eight hair-covered legs with more eyes than you can count will surely come in handy when performing manual tasks.
The character is a dwarf. Their legs are short, so they move slow, but they're healthy as an ox, can carry a human on each shoulder and can craft with their eyes shut.
The character is an elf. They are immortal beings known for greater wisdom and connection to magic.
The character is an orc. They are a warrior race that lives in a matriarchal clan structure. They are known for their strength, ferocity and despise of 1h weapons.
The character is a goblin. They love tinkering, so they are better at research and rituals.
The character is a demon. A creature weaved from magic, which gives them bonuses to faith. They also tend to be great talkers.

The character is a demon of the night. A creature weaved from magic, which gives them bonuses to faith. These night demons are known for their silver tongues despite their terrible looks. The striga will take the health of its companions each turn to sustain itself.
The character is a Guardian Demon. It is bound to the Idol that brought it to life and sworn to protect it. Cannot travel outside the village.
The character is a night demon. They receive a bonus to Faith and a special Mental attack. They are weak during the day and stronger during the night.
The character is an unliving. Awakened by a mystical call and given a new life-force. They are dead, so it does make them physically tougher.
The character is a dragon. An ancient, intelligent beast feared throughout the ages. Known to like gold, gems and virgins.
The character is a zmey. Forever connected to darkness, but also the tree of life, a foe or friend, one can never know with the zmey.
Once a mighty dragon, now a terrifying unliving fiend.

The character is a dragon. An ancient, intelligent beast feared throughout the ages. Known to like gold, gems and virgins. This one is stricken with light-sickness that weakens them but may make them more cranky too.
The character is a troll, can regenerate physical wounds and gets a small shielding bonus.
The character is a Child of Darkness. They are stronger during the night.
The character is a Child of Darkness. The are stronger during the night and can copy health.
The character is a spider. It has eight hairy legs, which let him do any kind of manual work a lot faster.
Horz's Trait bonus - this character is stronger during the night and weaker during the day.
A powerful ally... for a price.
Zorya's Trait bonus - this character's Delay will decrease for each other enemy character placed on the battlefield after them.
Being a Chosen is not an easy task. Triglav appreciated that and decided to bestow a special ability on his chosen follower.
If your Chosen dies, they change into an unliving corpse. Additionally, all your characters have a lower chance to die from heavy wounds..
Allows to sail on seas. Slow with small capacity.
Allows to sail on seas. Very light yet surprisingly capacious.
Allows to sail on seas. Fast with medium capacity.
Allows to sail on seas. Slow with big capacity.
You become the gate of cosmic energy.
The stigma you carry is a burden on both your mind and soul. Your Intelligence, Wisdom, Destiny and Mysticism are lowered. Survive this lenghty trial and be freed from it, or perish.
Clanless dwarves suffer from an odd form of hunger - they need to ingest a metal bar each turn. Every time this character ingests a metal bar, they are closer to getting rid of this weakness.

The common folk have a saying - 'Never eat more than you can lift'. But dwarves lift a lot and they surely aren't common folk! As a Dwarf, this character has chance to eat 1 extra {ICON:FoodIcon} per turn.
This character refuses to wear any equipment other than weapons, but their songs put all group members minds at ease, increasing Sanity regeneration.

One of your groups has run out of food, or only carry food they are not allowed to consume. Starving characters loose health points each turn.\n\nClick to open this group's inventory.

One or more characters has below 30% Health and may die. Set up a camp to speed up health recovery.\n\nClick to open the affected group's inventory.

One or more characters has below 30% Sanity and their morale is decreased. Their damage is lowered and there's a chance they will leave your group.

Improve their Morale by providing varied food.

Click to open the affected group's inventory.

One or more characters below 30% Faith and are poisoned by magic. They will receive damage equal to portion of their health each turn. Perform the Spiritual Healing ritual and/or improve Morale to regenerate Faith.\n\nClick to open the affected group's inventory.

One or more characters feels their Morale is very low may leave to look for a better future away from you. Provide varied meals, let them rest in comfy beds and keep their Sanity high to recover Morale.\n\nClick to open the affected group's inventory.
One or more characters has equipped items that weigh more than they can handle. They will suffer penalties until they take off some of that stuff.\n\nClick to open the affected group's inventory.

One of your groups is carrying more than they can handle and will suffer penalties. Their movement is reduced by 1MP for every 10% of weight they carry above their limit.\n\nClick to open the affected group's inventory.

Collecting these will allow your characters to level up, improving their attributes and skills. Experience Points are divided equally among all members of the group that takes part in an event or a challenge.
Gather enough of these and you'll earn an Advancement Point, which you can use to unlock new resources, equipment recipes, buildings or rituals.
Day turns provide better visibility and roaming monsters are less aggressive.
Visibility is limited during night turns and roaming monsters are more likely to follow your groups and attack.

How many items you receive when production is finished.

Changes to some of the game's XML files require item cache to be rebuilt, otherwise crashes will occur. When this toggle is off, the game will rebuild the item cache every time there's a change in the XML files.\n\nSome changes however are safe (ie. localisation files) and do not require a new item cache. Set the toggle to on to force the game to use the old item cache, if it can be loaded.

In a Physical challenge against characters you can use both skills from equipment you wear and innate. Any Health wounds sustained during the challenge will persist after the challenge ends.

Items made from this kind of resource require more work, but are a bit lighter, faster and of slightly higher value.\nCrafting from Improved resources carries a small risk of failure and the item being Trash Quality.

Items made from this kind of resource require much more work, have a significantly better value and increased essence amounts.\nThe risk of failing a craft using Wild resources is significant so make sure your Craftsmen are experienced or you might end up with a Trash Quality item.
Shows a chance the item will be of Masterwork quality. More skilled Craftsmen are more likely to produce Masterwork quality items. Such items have increased Essence bonus.

Shows a chance the item will be of Trash quality. More skilled Craftsmen are less likely to produce a Trash Quality item. Such items lose the properties from Improved or Wild resources and have reduced Essence.
